cont.entity_a: Better sound including simulated surround. Superb sound on the RS 85. Good sound. The sound quality is fine. Sound quality is so-so.
cont.entity_b: Sounds great. Beautiful sound with highs, mids, and bass well-represented. Sound stage is full and broad. Warm listening experience with well-extended bass. Clear, bright highs. Bass is clear and natural. Best sound quality for the price. Crystal-clear accuracy with a smooth sound. Sound is smooth and balanced with great clarity. Sound stage is spacious with great imaging.

cont.entity_a: Better fit. The headphones are lightweight and comfortable.
cont.entity_b: Tight fit on the head initially. Very comfortable and lightweight.

cont.entity_a: Poor construction leading to breakage. The headphones last about 6 months due to cheap construction.
cont.entity_b: Cheaply made, left side started cutting out after six months.

cont.entity_a: Way better battery life. Proprietary battery instead of a standard one. The battery lasts four hours.
The volume is low for the cost. Volume control is hard to find when adjusting during sleep.
Clarity and reception are better than the Advent brand, with occasional static. Reception cuts out when the phone rings.
The headphones are lightweight and comfortable.
No problems with breakage or wear after one year of use.
cont.entity_b: Great for mixing and mastering due to phenomenal accuracy. Great for PC gaming with external DAC and AMP.
Open back design doesn't provide noise cancellation. Detachable cable is convenient.
Requires a proper amp to drive them. Requires a powerful amp for optimal performance. Requires a decent amp and DAC for best performance.

cont.entity_a: Little or no sound leakage. Static noise occurs when moving your head.
cont.entity_b: Open back headphones are great for those with tinnitus.
